Computer Specs:

AMD Ryzen 7 1700 CPU
AMD Vega 64 GPU
32GB RAM
2TB Mushkin Reactor SSD

Cannot run the game past the second level of Chapter 2. It just freezes and crashes the moment I gain control of whichever character I select. I know the system requirements say that the game may not run well on AMD processors but this lack of optimization is just plain unacceptable.

Impressions (of the limited play-time I had) from someone new to the Neptunia franchise: English voice acting is rather bad, like "one person does most of the characters" bad. Story is mostly just there as an excuse for the gameplay to exist, and the AI is really dumb. Controls are loose and combos have no "feel" to them. Startup takes a while due to all the logos that will play before you get to the Title Screen. Needless to say, I'm getting a refund.

38700190.review:
与海王星正作不同，本作算是一个番外故事。为了拯救在游汐葉界中就读的学校，电影社社长Neptune带着文学少女Blanc，学生会副会长Noire，学生会会长Vert站出来成为偶像，呸，拍了部丧尸片。
在剧情方面，因为本作跟正传也没什么关系，所以剧情还是挺轻松搞笑的，声优们的表现也可圈可点，对于喜欢海王星系列的玩家还是值得一玩。
对于成就党而言，该作的成就获取难度也算是较低，除了打倒所有种类敌人需要细心不要漏怪和5000连击需要点技巧，剩下的成就基本不是通关送就是无脑刷，全成就还是比较容易的（虽然本人没有）。成就神作，值得一刷。
不过作为一款ACT游戏，本作的战斗还是有地方不太友好。永远锁到杂兵的锁定，不是XXXX就是XYXY的连招（大概是设计时候偷懒了），砍掉了不少连招套路，也降低了不少战斗时的乐趣，比较遗憾。
还有就是角色要跑到指定地点时才能刷怪，如果对地图不了解很容易出现跑一圈地图才找到刷怪点的蛋疼情况，而通关评价还跟通关时间挂钩......
总之优缺点并存，但是作为原发于PSV上的外传游戏，我觉得还是值得好评的。

38346409.review:
Idea Factory and Compile Heart games have a notrious reputation for being low-effort, and what do you get if you take their most popular Neptunia franchise and make a spin-off? The most medicore low-effort forgetable game.

Neptunia games live and die off their writing and even though the actual quality is rather debatable Megatagmention hits a very low point. The plot tries to sell its self on its cast trying to save its high school by making a zombie movie using the current sudden zombie outbreak to attract more students. It really, really tries to get into that its so bad its good category and ocassionaly there is a gem, but at all other times its meh.

Graphicaly the game looks exactly like a PSVITA game because that's what it is, and it rather bland forgetable environmen.ts. Enemies in the main campaign are a first for the series but repeat very often, while the multiplayer mode takes enemies from Action Unleashed.

Musically the game is average; some tracks such as the menu theme are above average, and transformation music for Neptune and co. are quite nice, but nothing sticks out compared to the previous mainline game Megadimension, so you won't be hearing anything on the level of 'Will be Venus' or 'Dimension Zero'.

Gamplay wise, this is where this game really shows its lackluster design. Basic hack and slash mechanics are there for all the characters, which can all perform one or two combos each, and can transorm to change up their small moveset slightly. MegaTagmention controls relatively well, combos have weight and moves are satisfying to pull off, however jumping feels very heavy and unnatural, and the double jump timing is very strick. Characters have a dodge technique whcih blasts them across the field at the speed of sound, but feels highly difficult to aim. Besides basic combos, guards and counterattacks also exist, however they can be slightly difficult to activate due to the unoptimised controller layout straight from PSVITA. Characters have 4 special attacks that they can use when their SP Gauge fills up and these can be very useful for crowd control. Characters can bring two allies into battle which can be used via a button combination that can boost attack, defense, restore HP, restore transform gauge or other effects. You'll quickly discover all you need is transofrm gauge recovery and HP recovery.

Your transformation gauge is charged by hitting enemies, and when it is filled to half or more you can transform into the CPU or a more souped up form of your current character that has different combos, different SP moves and is more powerful. It can also be used to perform powerful EXE and Lily attacks (attacks based on your bond with a different character, raises the more you fight with them). EXE attacks however have a severe oversight where they will knock enemies out of their combos, meaning it will do a fraction of the possible damage.

The two characters you chose into battle when they win (or lose) will gain experience and a boost in their Lily Rank plus money and drops, which presents a problem for the short 6-7 hour campaign. Characters that you don't use won't level up meaning that if you want to use them you will have to grind them up, meaning you will keep sticking with your tried and true character combination. This would be more of a problem if the game wasn't so easy. Enemies largely sit around and look pretty, there isn't much variation in big enemies besides hit and dash, and the game doesn't even feature a proper boss until the end of the campaign! Map design is very small and linear, and largely doesn't effect the way you fight foes. Due to the game featuring more then 10 characters in its short-campgin you won't get bored until the end.

Money can be used to buy weapons, patches, and visual accessories at the store to applly to those weapons to give to your characters to buff them making fights easier. Patches and drops can be fused together to make even better patches, and drops you obtain from mission can be used to unlock costumes for your characters. This system is rather basic, but can be fun to play around with. However, buying weapons reinforces using a minimal amount of characters for your playthrough.

From my brief 1 hour experience with multplayer, enemies from Action Unleashed are back providing much needed variety and 6 big proper bosses that should of been in the main story, alongside a use for your much stronger weapons. Multiplayer gets rid of allies, Lily attacks, and bring two characters in exchange to work together with 3 other players, being able to freely revieve them, and to use a character pre-transormed or that one in the base form unable to tranasofmr. Due to the higher difficultly, better play is required but not too much. I had no connection issues, and the communicatioon menu provided gives a wide range of options to say phrases that translate to other languages well. 

In closing, MegaTagmention Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is a medicore hack and slash game that doesn't feature anything noticable of interesting. It plays perfectly fine with some minor quips with controls and physics, but the story is very, very weak, with few funny moments typical of Neptunia games. Idea Factory and Compile Heart have showed they can make quality games with the release of Megadimension Neptunia VII, but they haven't followed through with their efforts with spin-off games. Skip this unless you are a big Neptunia wee-I mean fan AND only if it is on sale.

38280157.review:
So it took me about 24 hours to play and beat it completely, other than some achievements. By that, I mean Triple SSSing everything in singleplayer and multiplayer, and when I went to check my rank is 267 so not bad eh?

I mean, its fun, theres some customization but not a lot. I mean, if I was going to go and get all the achievements and level every character to 99 then sure it might take longer but I feel I can say I've beat everything the game has to offer. I got it on sale for five bucks, so not a bad deal for the amount of time I invested in it. But, content wise there's not a lot here. Not a lot of enemy variety, not much of a story, the maps arent very big, the combo system is pretty easy to master.

I typically avoid fighting games... and this one was still kinda fun like I said. I dont know if I could recommend it at full price so wait for a sale if you really want it, or look around for other places and not just on steam to see has the best deal.

38265332.review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is a Hack and Slay game like Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed was. But there are some differences between those two games. MegaTagmension has a bigger selection of characters than Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. The combat also feels faster which made this as a Hack and Slay a lot more enjoyable. The quests you do don't just take place on a big stage anymore where you have to defeat a bunch of enemies but rather on a bigger area where the enemies are sometimes scattered throughout said area. But this only applies sometimes to even rarely. Most of the enemies spawn at the same spot as you do and most of the quests can be done on this said spot. Most of the quests take place on bigger areas but most of them don't use them effectively as you only have to fight your way through the enemies at one spot. Because of this most of the quests can be done in under one minute, which also feels kinda odd when they are giving you a time limit of 30-60 minutes. Also there isn't much variety of the enemy types you are going to face. The enemies you fight at the beginning are also the ones you are going to face throughout the entire game. This also applies to all of the bosses except for the final one of course. If you get the hang of these bosses you will most likely get bored to face the same bosses over and over again. On a positive note. All of the characters you are able to play feel different and you will most likely find one that suits your playstyle best. But there is also one problem with leveling those characters. You unlock more characters as you make your way through the story of this game. The problem with that is that all the characters that join your party at a later point are at a very low level and you either have to grind with them first to use them on the current quest you have to do effectively or just ditch them and stick with the characters you used up to this point. Also the amount of EXP you get for each quest isn't as high as it used to be in Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. It feels like you don't get enough EXP for each quest. To level up even once you have to do the same quest multiple times. So if you want to beat the story as fast as you can it may be best to stick with the characters you get at the beginning. The last point I'm going to talk about is the story. The story is enjoyable but it's not very good. To keep it short. Blanc and her friend are trying to make a movie to save their school. While they're filming a zombie virus is spreading all over their school and they have to take care of that. That's all you need to know for now. All the characters behave the way you expect them to behave and the setting is pretty refreshing for a Neptunia game. After you beat the story there isn't much to do anymore. You don't unlock additional quests or challenges. You can only play through the story missions again.

In conlusion the game is best suited for you if you are fan of the Neptunia franchise and enjoyed Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. The dialogue is pretty funny and the game uses original music aswell as music from previous installments. The game has it's flaws but it is also very enjoyable. But due to it's short playtime I would recommend to buy this game on sale.

37662153.review:
差评！必须差评！尽管手动全成就了！
首先吐槽下剧情，各种莫名其妙，不过看在偏无厘头风格，这点就算了。
然后吐槽战斗，布兰是主角啊。。为什么那么难用。。那个5000连击的成就谁设置的，出来我保证打不死他，断连击好几次总算做成了。还有一些图，怪物的生成地点根本没有提示，于是我绕着地图转两三圈怪物才生成，简直有毒。
在幕后事件方面我觉得还不错，小故事都挺有意思的，还好不要求百合度不然我得刷吐血，这点给个好评。
全对话这个谁设置的我也要打死他，我是看着攻略表格解锁的，为什么同一章节同样的对话仅仅换了个人我就得再打两遍，尤其是整个第六章打了三遍，简直绝望，刷这个花掉我三四个小时，这还是在通关能开启秘技的情况下刷的。
技能点方面也很坑，主用涅普，升到99级发现还有几个地方不够升级的，而技能点已经无法再获得了。不过后来似乎触发了奇怪的bug，每个人都再拿到了5w多点，虽然是良性bug，但也得差评。
在角色数值方面，似乎伤害与防御是呈线性关系的？满级防御打后面的boss几乎不掉血。。。这样有点没意思啊。。
一些boss的走位相当风骚，尤其是兽型boss，刚玩的时候虐得要死要活的，各种空大，不过，大招不就是用来空的吗？（笑）
联机的话，也算是比较好评的，似乎怪物血量有翻倍，一般来说就是大神带萌新，有幸被大佬带过，也带过萌新，这个体验还是不错的。
联机任务刷黑历史就有点烦了，尤其是打Dark Purple/white拿宝物材料的时候，刷了十数次才爆出素材，达成全成就。要是不看攻略只凭自己摸索的话不知要猴年马月才能凑齐。。。
服装大大的好评，历代海王星都是这点让我喜欢，收集那么久的材料正是为了换装嘛。变身装的话。。我一律选择破碎装，嘿嘿。
这游戏真是让人又恨又爱，虽然嘴上要差评，但最后还是默默改成好评了，海王星天下第一！

[h1] 导语	[/h1]
  [b] [i] —"你是否曾幻想过与另一个次元中的纸片人小女孩一同在同一所高中里生活？你是否曾幻想过与心中の女神一起在高考来临之际疯狂修仙？你是否还曾幻想过在世界最危急的时刻能够像电影中的主角一样英雄救美？呃，反正我是没想过。[strike] （那就怪了。一本正经的胡说八道、又喝了吧你？）	[/strike]	[/i][/b]
  但是你是否想体验一下完全不同风格的校园+无双+伪生化危机系的海王星呢？涅普顿和布兰激次元组合欢迎你。当然，如果不是只是为了单纯来找老婆♂的话。"
[h1] 《MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (Neptunia)》	[/h1]
  与[url=store.steampowered.com/app/387340/Hyperdimension_Neptunia_U_Action_Unleashed/] Hyper D：U	[/url]相同，更确切一些的说是U的进化版本，与同为Hack 'n' Slash的U相比多了更多的可选任务及人物，并加入了防御键，故事情节也更加引人入胜，相对于海王星历来以代表国家立场的守护女神身份为背景进行的宏大的故事主线，激次元组合反之选择了箐箐校园中的日常学习生活的设定，并将背负着国家命运的女神们的领导人身份暂时全部放下，本来相持不同政见的四位强大的守护女神在激次元组合中瞬间转变成了同级的同班同学！这样有趣的设定实在不得不令人拍手称赞，[spoiler] 令人窒息的操作	[/spoiler]这是为什么呢？因为原本就有很多恩怨纠葛的四女神们以前还可以在厌烦争斗之时回到自己的国家境内短暂避开“仇敌”休息一下，但是现在呢？如此戏剧化的后果可想而知，故事剧情发展自然非常真实且生动[strike] （时而暴力）	[/strike]。
  但说了这么多，真实的感受还是需要自己去体验的，明眼人♂不难发现这篇评测至此仍未出现任何与以往类似的哲学♂化片段，所以[strike] （江郎才尽了？不！）	[/strike]这只是为了“爱的付出”的短暂牺牲而已。[spoiler] 头上的羽翼锤仿佛随时要砸下的样子……	[/spoiler]
  游戏生活化、萌豚游戏生活化，最重要的是海王星校园生活化与我们的次元不是更加接近了吗？这才是真正的重点—To the youngth~❤；想想看年轻的你们未来的高中校园生活、以及让我们这些尚拥有一颗少年之心的成年人一起回忆一下当初我们的“热血”高校生活中的点点滴滴；这时，放下现今生活中的种种烦恼，回到家中，[spoiler] 换上钉刺♂皮革♂装，	[/spoiler]打开《激次元组合》，让我们与游戏中的她们一起携手再一次回到那个时候吧~
[h1] 游戏总评	[/h1]
  上手度很好，无论是从主机还是到PSP全系列优化做的都很到位，操作手感、特效和打击感等介于刀剑神域与无双之间，但缺点还是有的，很少但很让人在意的说；不错，就是镜头问题，相较于U的全自动化调节，激次元的设定比较反人类，战斗时的视角调节可以说是无双类游戏的命脉之一，视角需要自己手动调节、虽说有锁定敌人这么一说，但使用键盘的玩家就会相较于手柄玩家更吃力一些了。[spoiler] 小声告诉你，联机模式的特殊任务里竟然还有个小的跳台关卡~哈哈哈，想SSS？玩的时候强烈建议带一个有跳跃远程攻击+目标锁定跟踪的优妮及拉姆、罗姆[strike] （蕾姆？雾）	[/strike]吧。	[/spoiler]
  总计海王星系列目前只打过几次折，而且还都只是Sbeam春、夏、秋、冬季大折扣；So，二营长你他娘的还在等什么呢？还不快带你的兵去买啊？！

Videolarda düz vuruş ve kombolardan ibaret sıkıcı, boş ve düz bir oyun gibi görünüyor ama öyle değil oyun gerçekten çok eğlenceli hele yanınızda arkadaşlarınız varsa multiplayer modu daha da eğlenceli oluyor.

Oyunun controller ile oynanmasını şiddetle tavsiye ediyorum, klavyede oynarsanız oyun gerçekten bir işkenceye dönüşebilir.

Multiplayer modda 4 kişiye kadar birlikte oynayabiliyorsunuz, odanıza şifre koyabiliyorsunuz.

Multiplayer'daki günlük görev sistemi gerçekten hoş, oyuncuyu oyuna bağlayacak şekilde önemli itemler ve bol para veriyor.

Oyunun hem ingilizce hem japonca seslendirmeleri bulunuyor ve iki dilde de seslendirmeler gayet kaliteli (ingilizce seslendirmede ki Ram&Rom hariç ama bu benim görüşüm)

Oyunda gerçekten çok fazla karakter var ve bu karakterlerin transformlarını multiplayer da her karakter 1 level olsa bile seçebiliyoruz ama story mode da seçmek için story mode'u bitirmek gerekiyor ama oyun içinde transform olarak kullanabiliyoruz belirli bir süre için.

Biraz klişe bir hikayesi var, zombilere zombi demek imkansız ama oyun "Cute Girls Doing Cute Things" benzeri bir formatta olduğu için beni rahatsız etmedi.

Oyunda bölümleri oynayarak düşürdüğümüz Fragment'lerle kutuları açıp karakterler için kıyafetler elde edebiliyoruz, bütün kutuları açıcam diye ciddi ciddi uğraştım.

Bosslardan düşen Gear'lar ekstra statlar veriyor ama düşürmek biraz uğraştırıcı/sıkıcı gelebilir.

Verdiğim parayı kuruşu kuruşuna hak eden nadir oyunlardan biri.

36575719.review:
因为入读的学生人数骤减，所以正面临着废校的危机。其中有几位少女为了防止废校毅然站了出来，成为偶……嗯不好意思拿错剧本，是拍！电！影！全系列最欢脱的一作，目前英文文本最贴近日语原意的一作，唯一带有联机系统的一作，全成就最简单的一作，还是我家布兰做主角的一作，我当然是滋磁啊。[spoiler] 这作布兰的立绘换成侧脸，真鸡儿萌。[/spoiler]

前作U试水之后，地雷社得到的回馈和经验统统在这一做得到了体现——除了镜头距离无法调节以外和删除了爆衣系统外，各方面都相对于U有了极大的提升。难度虽然相对于U来说有不小的提升，但对稍微有动作游戏基础的玩家来说难度还是偏低，因此大可不必看数据选择自己喜欢的或者玩着爽的角色玩，个人推荐布兰、电击子和tamsoft。

布兰在U和VS里的动作不像正传里显得僵硬，女神化后更是十分的霸气，Lowee三女神的bgm也是四国里最燃的，因此即使不是[strike] 任豚[/strike]布兰粉也会玩的十分爽快；电击子依旧是空中连段最bug的存在，这一作居然一次滞空能两次空中连段，当然地面的连段也相较许多角色实用，技能十分的危险——包括了炮姐的弹硬币和夏娜的贽殿遮那，大招居然调出了SAO的UI和桐人的剑，如果哪天这游戏因版权问题下架了，那都是电击子的锅；tamsoft以自己为原型做出来的角色，不得不说十分偏心，设定巨乳，声优小清水美亚，武器太刀，招式居合，HDD化的武士盔甲和两本杂志的动物化鲜明对比，隐藏三连居合连段更是炫炸了，当然也有太脆和硬直太大的缺点，三连居合第二连不但难搓而且一旦失败中断连段硬直超大，上手难度比较高。

boss方面比较偷懒，虽然有八个，但是全部招式简单，配音敷衍，三个机器人丑的一匹，大鸟攻击模式完全就是羊库库，也就剧情里的那只双面人能看，掉落宝箱碎片和部件套装概率太低，好在难度不高可以单独刷联机任务[strike] 刷着刷着感觉自己像孤独之心[/strike]

35683057.review:
A game about lesbian anime schoolgirls fighting zombies? What could possibly go wrong?
A lot of things, actually. While the main series are RPG games this one is just a button mashing Hack ‘n Slash game in which your character is placed in an arena and need to defeat hordes of enemies. Some of the arenas are just circles and others have a few corridors leading to some open areas but there isn’t anything to explore at all. Just go after the zombies and that’s it. While at the first glance the combat system seems to be somewhat interesting in the end you will end up only spamming the same moves over and over again because the game doesn’t really encourage you to change combos and try something new. Just spam the moves you think are more powerful and that’s it. That said, the game gets repetitive fast and the story doesn’t help much. While some of the dialogues are actually fun the whole thing isn’t something that make you want to pay attention because it is actually poor. The game, just like in the original series, works with the level up system but now this time you actually need to distribute the points in the attributes you want to upgrade the most. And well… the balancing of this thing isn’t really good since if you just spend all your points and max out the defense attribute your character will be almost immune to damage, something that is a game breaking feature that should not exist outside the cheats (that you unlock after beating the game) That said you can make this game be painfully easy, just making things even more boring. Just like in the main games there's an item shop where you can buy new weapons and well… just buy the strongest one and that’s it. You don’t really need to plan anything since in this game, unlike in the main series, the weapon you wield don’t really changes your combos in any way. If there’s something in this game that I think it was a nice addition to the series is the customization. At the same time it is a bit too simple the game allows to resize the accessories and place them wherever the heck you wish. Like, literally. If you, for whatever reason, want to place a wrist watch inside the character's head, you can. If you want to shove something into their buttholes, you can also do that. If you want your character to have a giant hat flying upon their head, take a guess. YOU CAN! You can even pretend to be in TF2 and make a towering pillar of hats. But the customization isn’t only limited to accessories, you can also unlock different variations of the characters main outfit and, if you want, you can also use a torn-up version of their main set of clothing so they will fit more to the zombie apocalypse scenario. (We all know you will actually make your characters wear that for other reasons) The graphics are ok when it comes to the playable characters but the scenery is way too bland. Ahh, whatever, nobody plays Neptunia games for the graphics anyway. The soundtrack is mediocre at the best, you might just want to put something else to play on Spotify. There aren't many glitches to mention but one thing that is annoying is that the game sometimes stop working when you boot it up on full screen. I really recommend you to play the game in windowed mode so this problem won’t annoy you.
In an overall this is just a mediocre Hack ‘n Slash game that can only please Neptunia fans since it features a lot of different characters from different games and if you don’t even know who they are I don’t really think you’ll enjoy the game at all. And I can only recommend this game if it’s part of some sale since it doesn’t worth its full price.
[spoiler] I’m only giving this game a positive review because it did turn the NepGear x Uni ship into something real! [/spoiler]

35398502.review:
When I first started hearing about the Hyperdimension Neptunia side games, at first I was looking forward to them as a fan of the series and everything about it. Then felt rather disappointed when I started seeing the content of games like Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed or Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart. I felt like all they had to deliver was either over the top fanservice, which I'm not really okay with, in the series (I don't mind fanservice as long as it's not over the top, in this case) and... I don't think that having a tsundere character as a protagonist is a good idea. I feel like there's little to go with. And I really love Noire as a character. But like... particularly with Neptunia U. The way I see it is the following: "Ripping clothes in combat? Really? What am I playing? A Hyperdimension Neptunia game or a Senran Kagura game?"
What I can say is that my view on the Neptunia side games I'm aware of changed when I heard, saw and played MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies. This game ACTUALLY has something more to deliver, even if it's not much.
The game was released in 2015 in Japan and at the time, only for the PS Vita. Then a year later in North America and Europe. And got its Steam release that same year, in October 3rd.
[b] The story [/b] **SPOILERS AHEAD**: [spoiler] In order to learn more about humans, Neptune and the other CPUs have been attending classes, at Gamicademi. Neptune, Noire, Vert and Blanc are seniors, with Vert and Noire being the Student Council President and Vice President, Nepgear and Uni being juniors and Rom and Ram are in Elementary school. At this point in the story, Gamicademi is under the threat of being closed, due to birth rates being declined. Neptune, being the academy's Film Club president and wanting to save the school, she decides do make a zombie movie to submit it for a contest, along with the help of Blanc's sisters, Rom and Ram. While filming a scene for the movie, Blanc spots them and thinks they are being attacked by actual zombies, intervening and beating the crap out of them. After that, she is told of what's really going on and is asked by Neptune and her sisters to work with them, declining at first but then agreeing to work with them as long as she's the director and she's the one writing the script. What they didn't realize is that they accidentally summoned actual zombies into their world. Seeing as an opportunity to shoot scenes, Blanc takes advantage of the situation to help everyone saving the school and make the movie. Problem is, they don't have enough people to make the club official, so their activity is not exactly allowed by Vert and Noire. That is until they get more people to join them. Tamsoft, a fellow senior, agrees to work with them and enter the movie. And later on, so do two others, Dengekiko and Famitsu, the two Gamicademy reporters from the junior class, who have a rather lively rivalry towards each other. With enough people working with them, they decide to go Vert and Noire again to make the Film Club official, which Vert allows and decides to join them too, but Noire still doesn't really support the idea, not showing much faith in them and not wanting them to make themselves look bad. Later on in the game, Blanc finds a video on the internet which pretty much was the reason why Noire didn't want them to go through with the movie, as it's really embarrassing to her. She then joins Blanc and the others as long as Blanc keeps quiet about it. A few scenes later (the chapters are called scenes), they finish the movie and submit it. Though this isn't where it ends, as there's still the zombie problem to deal with. Though seeing as there are still zombies in the academy, Blanc takes the chance to write a sequel to her rather random movie, though her and the others start wondering about getting more people for the movie. Later on, Uzume arrives at Gamicademy as a transfer student and looking for the source of all the zombies, being later revealed to be an entity known as HachimaJin. With the purpose of her presence being made known, Uzume joins Blanc and the others to film the 2nd movie and to search for HachimaJin. But Blanc is still looking for more people since only one more person isn't enough. Neptune gets Plutia, another fellow senior whom is punishing a bully in her rather infamous HDD form when she is introduced. Rom and Ram get Peashy, whom is also in their elementary class. Now with enough people, they continue working on the movie while searching for HachimaJin's whereabouts. After being almost done, they realize that there's only one place where they haven't looked. A classroom which, according to Vert, shouldn't exist. The girls decide to go there to conduct their search and shoot the final scene. That's when HachimaJin shows up to them. The girls eventually defeat the entity and with that, they also finish the movie and things slowly go back to normal. Sometime later, they finish the editing of the 2nd movie, though they keep it to themselves as a memory. On that same day, they also get the contest's results, which gets a place in the honorable mentions. [/spoiler]
The story in itself... is nothing really special. It's not something memorable, but not something forgettable either, taking around 19-21 hours to complete.
[b] The gameplay [/b]: If you've played Neptunia U or some of the Senran Kagura games, you won't spot that many differences. If you didn't, then here's how it is. Unlike the main Hyperdimension Neptunia games, this game is pretty much a hack and slash. You have a total of 14 different characters to play as which are unlocked as you progress through the story and their transformed forms make it a total of 28 characters, which you get after you beat the story. Each with their own style of gameplay and special moves, some requiring more dexterity than others. But once you get the hang of their combos, the gameplay turns out to be what's probably the best part of the game. Though don't get used to having every action assigned to a single button press. Certain actions require small button combinations, so read the tutorials carefully.
This is also the very first Neptunia game to feature Multiplayer. Co-op, in this case. So if you got three more friends with the game, gather round, set up a room and have fun. It's worth it if you're hunting collectibles, which unlock mostly just outfits for the characters.
[b] The graphics [/b]: For a port of the PS Vita, I'd say the graphics look rather decent. It retains the art style that has always been used for the series and I never really encountered any graphical glitches in the game.
Lastly, I should mention the sountrack, which is a mixed bag. Not in a bad sense, though. While it re-uses tracks from previous games, MegaTagmension also has a few tracks of its own. But nevertheless, the music is always really enjoyable.
So with that taken care of, it's time for the final score. Which, in my opinion, is a 6/10. It's slightly above average. I honestly wish I could give this game a higher score, but I can't. One aspect cannot carry the whole game on its own, no matter how good the gameplay is. While the graphics are decent, those don't make the game perfect. And the story could be a lot more memorable than it is. Even so, that shouldn't be a reason to not grab this game. If you're able to, get it and give it a shot. You won't regret it!

33576618.review:
MegaTagmension Blanc+Neptune vs Zombies  é mais um jogo spin-off da saga Neptunia, na qual muda-se o gênero, e ele é novamente um Hack n' Slash, como o NeptuniaU, mas dessa vez o jogo se passa em uma escola, sim, suas waifus de colegial com tema de zumbi e trazendo a possibilidade de se jogar online. Lembrando que nessa análise, comparações diretas serão feitas ao seu sucessor espiritual, o NeptuniaU.

     O jogo começa com a Blanc(que agora é a protagonista) falando que nessa dimensão, as deusas que eram muito próximas aos humanos decidiram ir à escola saber mais sobre a cultura humana. E também fala que a academia iria fechar por conta da baixa natalidade, causando a falta de alunos. Após isso, corta pra uma cena na qual as 4 deusas estão juntas e a Vert, que é a presidente do conselho estudantil, falando que a Gamicademi(a escola delas) fecharia no final do ano, a Neptune fala que o jogo acabou de começar e que ela não iria desistir. Inicia-se então o capítulo 1, que começa com a blanc na parte de fora da escola, lendo um livro, até que que ela ouve gritos de suas irmãs. Ela vai ver oque é elas estão sendo atacadas por zumbis, ai começa-se a primeira batalha que serve mais como um tutorial. Enfim, após a Blanc meter a mão na cara dos zumbis, a Ram pergunta porque ela fez aquilo e a Rom pergunta se os zumbis, que na verdade eram alunos vestidos estavam bem, Blanc ja não estava entendendo nada, mas aí Nep chega e explica pra ela que elas estavam fazendo um filme para salvar a escola e pede ajuda da Blanc...ela recusa, mas a Nep consegue convencer ela, dizendo que ela escreveria e dirigiria o filme. Após isso, começa o capítulo 2, que começa com elas em uma sala e a Nep apresentando os membros do clube, que são...ela mesmo, a nepgear, a Rom e a Ram, e a Blanc...que seria o quinto membro, ela vê que oque a Neptune tinha feito até agora era só colocar coisas aleatórias  e decide reescrever todo o filme, após um pouco de conversa, a Tamsoft, nova personagem...entra na sala perguntando se elas estão gravando e que tem zumbis la fora, elas dizem que não e vão ver os supostos zumbis, ela percebem que são zumbis de verdade e a Blanc tem a ideia de usar esses zumbis na gravação buscando deixar o filme mais realista, e é aí que o jogo realmente começa, com os objetivos de fazer o filme, salvar a escola e descobri porque os zumbis estavam ali.

     Bom, a história assim como a do NeptuniaU não é das melhores, mas a desse jogo é um pouco melhor, oque eu ja esperava ja que esse não é realmente o foco do jogo. E vale lembrar que ela se passa em dois momentos, um deles é elas interagindo e conversando e a outra seria a gravação do filme, com elas atuando.

     Mas agora vamos ao que realmente interessa, o jogo em si. E a primeira coisa a se falar é sobre os movimentos do jogo, esses que foram acrescentados alguns em relação ao outro jogo, nos podemos correr, alternar entre ataques fortes e fracos, dar um "dash", pular, usar skills e skills especiais,trocar de personagens na batalha, travar a mira no inimigo(esse que também serve pra mostrar a vida dele), defender, usar um suporte(esse que eu falerei depois), usar itens, além de se transformar. No jogo assim como no NeptuniaU você escolhe uma missão(as missões irregulares foram retiradas) e nela você pode escolher 2 personagens, mas agora são 14 personagens e mais suas formas transformadas(você pode transformar normalmente, mas com isso você pode começar com elas transformadas), essas que são liberadas após o zeramento, cada uma com suas respectivas individualidades, e outra...o jogo agora não te obriga a jogar com todas as personagens, ja que o jogo não faz você jogar determinadas fases com determinadas personagens, você pode jogar todas as fases com sua personagem favorita sou a com a personagem que você joga melhor, que é oque eu aconselho, eu por exemplo joguei a maior parte das missões com a Tamsoft. Ah! E aquele negócio de rasgar a roupa quando leva dano também foi retirado D:, é uma pena.

E agora, falando sobre os personagens de suporte, esses que são paralelos aos que você usa nas batalhas, agora você pode usar eles para ganhar perks durante as batalhas(como ataque, defesa, ou etc), você pode escolher 2 deles. Os cenários do jogo melhoraram se comparado ao seu antecessor, mas eles estão em menos quantidades, pelo menos na campanha, são escolas, cidades, florestas...mas não é possível  visualizar muitos detalhes ja que basicamente você não vai se movimentar muito nele, ja que você vai ficar basicamente em um lugar matando os monstros.

No menu do jogo, a Blanc fica do lado interagindo com oque você vai selecionando lá, caso você não faça nada, ela vai ficando entediada(bem legal kkk). No menu temos o "Action", que serve basicamente pra você jogar a campanha, "Setup" que serve pra você equipar os itens, mas aqui temos algumas mudanças, primeiramente nas armas, que agora você pode equipar um "perks" nela(como mais ataque, mais vida pra você, etc), a customização do jogo é a melhor da série, agora além de mudara a cor do cabelo e roupa(com itens que você ganha), você pode equipar acessórios, esses que podem colocados aonde você quiser na personagem...você pode colocar um chapéu no pé da personagem por exemplo, se você quiser, no Setup você ainda pode equipar as dark parts, essas que você ganha no multiplayer e também usar pontos de atributos para fortalecer as personagens, você pode distribuir os pontos em Vida, Ataque, Defesa e Técnica, essa que serve pra você desbloquear novos combos, pois nem todos são liberados no inicio do jogo(essa árvore que eu aconselho mais você investir), no menu ainda pode-se acessar a opção "Treasure", um Tesouro, que serve como aquelas moedas do jogo passado, também tem o "Shop", a loja do jogo...lá você pode comprar itens(armas, itens de fortalecimentos e aqueles perks das armas), vender itens e tbm fundir itens, que serve também para aqueles perks de armas, finalizando sobre o menu, você pode ir em "Config", configurações do jogo e "Exit" pra sair do jogo.

Aquele negócio de Lily Rank, continua aqui que serve para aqueles skills de dupla. A campanha ta bem curta, em cerca de 8 a 10h você pode finaliza-la, mas ela tem uma coisa especial...você pode mudar algumas personagens de algumas cutsceenes no jogo, em algumas fases se você colocar determinadas personagens na party, por exemplo, em uma parte do jogo, no filme que elas estão gravando, vai aparecer uma policial...que é a Uzume, mas, se você colocar na fase 8-1 a Uni e a Vert, essa policial vai ser a Uni...bem legal. Nesse jogo assim como no outro está REPLETO de loadings...loadings pra tudo que se faz...e também tem aquelas informações, que dessa vez em vez de informações sobre a personagem em si, vem informações sobre o gameplay com ela, se ela é rápida, se ela é lenta, etc, etc.

E finalmente falando sobre o diferencial do jogo, o multiplayer...esse que pode ser jogado em até 4 pessoas, e ele tem algumas diferenças da campanha normal...aki você tem que derrotar os "grandes chefes", esses que não encontrados na campanha, com o objetivo de encontrar aquelas dark parts, e além disso não é somente esse o conteúdo exclusivo do multiplayer, temos novos mapas, inimigos e etc, e além disso é mais dificultado, ja que vocês tão em grupo. Vocês ainda tem o lobby na qual serve como um Menu. O único problema, é não ter um chat, a única coisa que tem é uma espécie de mensagens pré-selecionadas na qual você pode mandar mensagens do tipo "Bom trabalho!" ou "Sim", "Não","vamos mais uma!", mas como são muitas mensagens, não tem muitos problemas de comunicação...mas seria melhor um chat mesmo. Sobre bugs, o único que realmente deu foi o jogo crashar.

MegaTagmension Blanc+Neptunia vs Zombies é mais um ótimo jogo, e mais um bom spin-off da série, com a oportunidade de multiplayer que deixou o jogo é melhor, e que pode não ter uma história muito boa mas isso não atrapalha no jogo. Antes de terminar nepnep>>>>all.

32673121.review:
那家官方卖挂的霓虹小作坊不知道什么时候搞出的游戏，我怎么不知道?9小时完结撒花

以下所指的U指的是本作的前作Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed

作为U这个伟大父亲的儿子(?)我要好好批判一番


+++更多的人物
++++优秀的打击感
++可以网络合作（但人并不是很多,来来去去就1，2个房间，刷久了很容易疲劳）
+++++十分有趣的装饰系统(屁股上呆毛一生堆？）
+++更容易上手
+++没有DLC（通关自动获得外挂）
++++升级加点
++++++++++魔法少女诺瓦铃！！！！

--剧情见仁见智，和U套路基本一样
---糟糕的人物平衡性(由于是割草游戏，敌人ai的弱智让他们在数量和攻击上得到提升，以至于那些攻速慢的角色根本就很难玩的转，一个不小心就会被连起来。虽然布兰是主角但因为她那拖沓的攻速，我根本没用过几次。如果想玩的爽的话还是用电机子吧)
---毫无用处的模组系统（与其去合成或购买一个只能用几次就没了的模组，我更愿意把他们卖了换钱买把好点的武器）
----非常垃圾的锁敌系统（我瞄着前面，怎么tm的锁到后面去了？空大也是会经常发生）
---缺少了限定角色的任务（导致那些本来就冷门的人物更没人玩了）
-----游戏流程太短（短了三倍!)
-----不能爆衣(R18补丁一打根本就是一部果体秀，失去了U的那种视觉冲击? (////w///))
-移植于psv（无法同屏双人，敌人一波波地刷，一次只有小气地几十个怪，刷完一波又一波。画面表现和U没有多大进步。既然你们这么喜欢赚钱，那干嘛不出个ps4版，然后再把ps4版的移植到pc,你们也乐玩家也买单岂不美哉？）


综上所述，如果要在U和僵尸军团中推荐一个的话，我会推荐U，我不认为一个饰品系统值88块钱。如果真的很想买这部的话推荐的价格在30元以下（夏促入手= /w|=)

写完之后103了,日

Les maps sont plus grandes et surtout plus vides que jamais, dommages.

Moins de plaisir de destruction massive car les ennemis sont beaucoup moins nombreux que dans Action U.

Le gameplay est plus nerveux qu'avant (surtout avec Uni), on dash dans tous les sens, on vole comme des furies, toutefois les enchainements sont moins faciles à mettre en place, vous êtes vulnérable quand vous les faites, il y a un temps d'animation maintenant ce qui rajoute de la difficulté mais qui retire un peu au plaisir de jeu selon moi. 

Enfin ils ont ajouté une commande pour bloquer les coups, merci.

Le gameplay a perdu un peu de son charme même si il s'est étoffé un peu, je pense qu'il mérite encore quelques ajustements avant d'avoir vraiment LA bonne recette.

En ce qui concerne l'histoire : elle est très bonne, très drôle comme toujours, mais avec une durée de vie pitoyable pour un HN même si la rejouabilité est bien là, je n'apprécie pas la méthode utilisée qui consiste à refaire l'histoire à tour de rôle avec les autres personnages pour débloquer les scènes inédites, tout comme monter le lily rank vu le nombre de personnage c'est juste du farm no brain top long et bourratif, surtout que je m'étais déjà bien embêté sur celui d'avant pour le lily rank alors refaire ça ici non merci ça suffit les conneries.

Ce jeu dispose d'un multi qui n'est plus joué et qui n'a que peu d'intérêt, il n'a pas d'autres modes de jeu.

Pour le prix en toute franchise il mérite tout juste un pouce bleu, j'espère néanmoins qu'ils feront mieux que ça la prochaine fois "errare humanum est, ced perseverare diabolicum est".

31696519.review:
I will give you a brief overview of the plot.

This time "for some reason" the goddesses are highschool students.

That reason being, schoolgirl outfits I'm sure... And in this school, there is a film club. In previous games Blanc has always been pegged with the trope of being a reader and being a creative writer. So, this outing, which is accredited to her, she is the film club "writer" and she narrates the "story" but this is not all, the film club is doing an amateur film about Zombies, at the same time as there is an actual Zombie outbreak at their school.

So, the anime-girl-anthropomorphised console wars have done a spin off game where they are high school students, who are making a zombie film, at the same time as a zombie outbreak. Simple eh, I don't know why some people may think these games are not accessible!

It pretty much follows as a cookie cutter of Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action unleashed, without the gratuitous "clothes breaking", and a couple of new features and tweaks to levelling up.


All this additional stuff is good, but I had way more fun on Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action unleashed. And its down to one very superficial reason, loading times.

It's so slow, I checked it out and its a know issue for the PC version, but I find it frustratingly long, and especially for a game which places you in a fast paced action environment, the change of pace seems obnoxious!

As much as it pains me to "dislike" a spin-off game about anime-girl-anthropomorphised console wars, where they are high school students, who are making a zombie film, at the same time as a zombie outbreak. I cant forgive those loading times.

31260597.review:
Before i get into my review, let me say this, unless you are big fan of the neptunia series, don't get this game.
P.S. I'm quite a big fan of neptunia thus the positve review.

Story
The story is light and easy going, it features the characters going through a sort of "normal life" with a bit of zombies, which the zombies are treated almost like a joke, which is sort of fun to watch. But if you are expecting the usual hillarious comedy from the neptunia series, sadly this game doesnt have such a comedic touch. But if you are here see a chance of Blanc being an MC, you have come to the right place

Music
The music for the game is nice, it does fit every scene quite well and I enjoy the music.

Gameplay
For this part, i have to admit, it is horrible. First, the enemy lock on function is broken, it is hard to even lock on an enemy, which means it is hard to hit an enemy without a lock on. But then even so, there is another point, the enemy attack patterns are properly, they look like dummies that just sit there and wait for you to hit. The whole gameplay is sort of repeatative as there is not much diffrence between the enemies which most of the time i just mash "Y" for Rom, without using any of the other combos.  The maps are also not fully filled and mostly reused.

Art
Reuse, Reuse, Reuse
A lot of art assets are heavily reused, from the enviroments to enenies. The reuse rate of art assets for the enviroment and the enemies is 10x worse than in usual main series. 

But as for the character wise, the art is quite good as usual, and also you have a pool of accesories to choose from, and customizable on the x,y,z axis of the characters, meaning you can place wherever you like. But i do see complains that the clothes choices are limited compared to its Hack and Slash precessor Neptunia U.

UI
For UI navigation, I have no complains about this, the UI is easily understanble and I can navigate through it with ease.
But compared to the usual neptunia UIs, this game has terrible UI Art Design, The whole UI of the game looks like it came from student project. The Design of the buttons looks a bit plain and bland in my opinion, could have done better.

Overall i would still recommend the game for Neptunia fans, the game has potential, but just too many issues within it.
Game: 7/10
Story: 8/10
Art: 7/10
Gameplay: 5/10
Music: 9/10
UI: 5/10

笔记本玩不了这款游戏！重要的事情我得说三遍，若你是笔记本+win10要谨慎下载。
本人用其他途径玩完了这款作品，给准备入手的小伙伴们一点建议（In Chinese(◐‿◑)﻿）
这部作品和其他本系列的操作不一样，很多新手玩家在问如何变身啊……第八章那个地方为什么闪退啊这类的问题，一一介绍下，变身用视角归正键（预设为R）加空格键跳跃。闪退则是使用了修改器和汉化补丁的缘故。如果闪退，把汉化退掉，把这个章节点过去，再重新汉化即可！
本作延续了系列的很好的打击感，并且通过这样一个小剧场一般的游戏，让女神+妹妹们的好感度再次直升(/ω＼)

30935143.review:
2017年5月8日更新，以前的内容全部划掉
现在几乎全成就了，再回去打了一下Nep U,很明显还是本作的打击手感强
被击中和防御有很不错的画面抖动特效，这在前作中是没有的
虽然本作中很多角色上手难度太高了（Blanc Plutia  Vert  以及喜闻乐见的香港记者二人组）
但是这比前作简单的不知道哪里去了好不好？
这让我这个一直练习Nep（U Slash）的人都感觉自己Too young too simple,sometimes Naive

[strike]反正Plutia满身的Nepshine看着很舒服[/strike]
==============================黑历史划分线==============================

[strike]我看看这游戏里谁敢说：“来个法师”，“来个射手”，“来个战士”，不仅难以操控，不秒了你们算我输[/strike]
很意外，本作几乎可以体验到地雷社所有Nep系列的角色，而且都为此  重新  设计了连招表
前作U中，你可以用Uni和Nep守小道（Nep不做描述因为没变过，Uni的攻击在U是有往前飞行的子弹的，只要命中就有伤害和击退。我甚至怀疑她用的不是步枪而是玩具枪。不仅距离神近无比，连个击退都没有。）
本作中你只需要开局选择Nep，进去后无脑XXXXX连招切菜，BOSS出现LB+Y放大招秒人完事。（务必确认一下生命条上面的蓝条，那个条有没有充满决定了你用EXE的威力和能否变身）
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+ 主菜单页面、宝藏和商店页面如果你挂机，他会一直提示你“快要没电了哦“之类的话（铁锤女说的话除外）
+ 人物装饰品可以自己修改坐标，可以拿来做奇怪的事情
+ 相信我，这游戏的音乐很带感，[spoiler]可惜我真的很贫困 [/spoiler]
+ 战斗时注意右上角，与前作相比，角色的对话不会干扰到视角了，并且为此专门绘制了8位点阵图
+ 所有对话都是有语音的
[spoiler]+ 战斗中对于几位巨乳角色似乎专门做了乳摇特效（奶子！）[/spoiler]
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- 建模依旧是地雷社风格：没有抗锯齿，没有高清。尤其是Uni的武器，平面感太强以至于怀疑这是块纸板
[spoiler]- 为什么要和谐我们的果衣？？？你设置一个R18不就可以了嘛[/spoiler]
- 与前作U相比，打击感稍差，连招不顺畅
- 这游戏调整分辨率会死机。开关显示器也会导致死机（显示器问题应该是个别）
- 战斗说明有点不明不白的（重申：LB+B换人，我重看3遍教程才发现）
- 这游戏没有真正的暂停，除非你选择摄像机视角（而且有限，不能往上看[spoiler]没有胖次，呸[/spoiler]）
总体来说，只能值打折这个价格。不过如果地雷社你的DLC音轨包如果良心一点大可以喜+1
[strike]地雷社啊，虽然我知道移植PC你不同意，是iF强行让你这么干的，不过拜托捡起你们的节操行不行？不然你们的campa永远不会出现在我们的选择序列里[/strike]

30899152.review:
Начну с того, что данную игру нередко определяют как своего рода сиквел Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed, да и геймплей у них не далеко ушёл друг от друга, потому готовьтесь к тому, что весь обзор будет сравнением.
[list]
    [*]Если Hyperdimension Neptunia U обладала довольно яркой графикой, то в Blanc + Neptune вы увидите яркими только главгероинь, сами же локации довольно скудные, безцветные, и чертовски мелкие. Локации тут правильнее назвать будет аренами, благо если в Neptunia U мы хоть продвигались от места к месту, то тут тупо драка в четырёх стенах (даже если вы на улице).
    [*]Если в Neptunia U врагами были монстрики из предыдущих частей серии, то здесь это уродливые зомбари, на которых сказать, что противно смотреть - ничего не сказать, ибо от них блевать хочется. К тому же, монстры в Neptunia U были довольно крепкими, что позволяло растянуть удовольствие от их избиения, а тут враги дохнут либо с одного комбо, либо с одно скилла. И о каком удовольствии может идти речь?
    [*]Если бои в Neptunia U происходят довольно динамично, то тут всё заторможенно так сильно, будто на вашем оружии висит 10ти-тонный груз, но убогость игрового процесса этим не заканчивается: после каждого комбо или скилла вы смотрите длинную анимацию, как главгероиня убирает в ножны меч или принимает боевую стойку. Во время таких анимаций персонаж неуправляем, потому вы тут же получите в рыло. Единственный способ обойти эту фигню - увороты посреди комбо. Мотивация? - Не пи*%ите.
    [*]Камера... Нет, я понимаю, что, как во всяком слэшере, тут вид от третьего лица, потому камера фокусируется со стороны персонажа... НО КАКОГО ХРЕНА В ЭТОЙ ИГРЕ КАМЕРА ФОКУСИРУЕТСЯ НА Ж0ПУ ГЛАВГЕРОИНЬ?! Эту х%№ню ещё и не перенастроить!
[/list]
Ладно, хоре уже этого хейта. Признаюсь, в Blanc + Neptune есть небольшое преимущество в лице большей численности персонажей, но, при её недостатках, этого мало. Лучше покупайте [url=store.steampowered.com/app/387340/?snr=1_5_9__205]Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed[/url] и наслаждайтесь, а про этот ущербный сиквел забудьте.

Несмотря на то, что контента тут ещё меньше, чем в убогой Нептуне U, я рекомендую эту игруху. Но со скидкой и только для любителей гринда, ибо другого игра предложить не может. И лучше делать это дозированно)

Тут есть два режима игры: режим истории и онлайновый кооператив на 4 игроков, который спокойно проходится соло, если вы forever alone, ну или онлайн мертв (оба варианта на данный момент в силе)).

В отличии от той же нептуны U, тут есть сюжет в сюжетном режиме. Но он такой, кх, никакой. Так что его нет. По сути стори тут это только подготовка к онлайну. По ходу сюжета к вам присоеденяюся новые персонажи, включая 4 новых которых не было в U, но всем, за исключением главного костяка персонажей, уделено настолько мало времени, насколько возможно. 3 новым персам буквально уделено 1-2 минуты в приветствии и всё. Ну ещё 3 сайд ивента, которых тут с натяжкой наберется десяток. И создаётся ощущение, что их ввели тупо ради этих ивентов. 
Сам режим истории разбит на сцены, аля мини-миссии. И под мини я имею в виду, что они очень маленькие. По 1-3 минуты макс. За всё время до платины не было более длинных. И в каком-то смысле это хорошо, т.к. квесты в U были очень унылы и однообразны. Тут тоже, но не такие долгие) Ещё в зависимости от выбранных персонажей, некоторые сценки перед уровнем изменятся. На такие сценки есть по 3 варианта. Но они настолько одинаковые, что буквально отличаются парой слов. Местные сайд-ивенты "находятся" таким же способом.
После прохождения сего сюжетного безобразия открывают читы аля ваншот, неуязвимости и т.д. Но они не работают в онлайне, где от них был бы хоть какой то толк. Тут в отличии от нептуны U, после прохождения сюжета в нем ловить совершенно нечего. Разве что уровни для онлайна поднимать.

В плане игры тут есть улучшения: появилось больше кастомизаций, выкинули бессмысленный фан-сервис (хотя его остатки можно найти в гардеробе). В пушки можно вставлять всякие полезные и не очень бафы, количество которых зависит от памяти пух (чем сильнее, тем меньше). Можно выбирать 2 супортов, которые дают небольшие бусты во время квестов, но требуют небольшой перезарядки. Как и в U, нужно играть за 2 персов. Но супорты и второй персонаж недоступны в онлайне. Так же за повышение уровня дают AP, которые нужно раскидывать в 4 стата: Хп, Атака, Защита и Комбо. Последнее открывает новые удары. А теперь о веселом - балансе. Которого нет. Опять. Если все AP за повышение кидать в защиту, то к концу истории вам будут сносить 0 урона. А если ещё вкинуть AP из онлайн режима, то даже финал босс 99 уровня вам ничего не сможет сделать. Ещё появилась возможность использовать предметы, т.к. в отличии от U, лечилки больше не выпадают. Но я за всю игру не воспользовался ни одним предметом. И в онлайне их нельзя использовать, или я просто не понял как)

Насчет онлайна, тут всё просто. Выбрал перса и вперед, проходить квесты на 6 уровнях сложности. Все персонажи открыты сразу, вне зависимости от прохождения сюжета. Есть ежедневные квесты, которые меняются в течении недели, и в воскресенье все сразу с перерывом в 2 часа. 
В отличии от режима истории, где босс по сути всего 1, и то финальный, тут их 15. Правда из них 6 рескинов ( с натяжкой 9). И в этом режиме вы проведете довольно много времени, если захотите выбить ачивки или собрать уникальные шмотки, которые есть только в этом режиме
( у меня ушло 5 часов на стори, и 10 на мульти).

Почему же я рекомендую? Сам не знаю) В отличии от нептуны U, в бланка просто приятнеё играть. Ещё тут довольно клевый ост, не тот который взят из других нептун, а новый. Хотя он по мне не подходит этой игре, уж очень местами он мне напомнил Guilty Gear) И его вполне можно слушать в отрыве от игры.

Если вы следили за спиноффами к нептунии, то вы уже видели подобную игру. Как и Hyperdimension Neptunia Action U, эта игра является слешером. Вот только, к сожалению, создать Action U 2 разработчикам не удалось.
Плюсы: 
-какая-никакая, а история. Хотя движется она и в основном за счет ввода новых персонажей.
-улучшенные опции кастомизации, включая возможность раскидывать очки развития по характеристикам.
-оригинальный контент в виде уровней и монстров, а так же нового персонажа - Тамсофт.
-более тактические бои и правка баланса ("юлы" непки или непгиа больше нет).
-персонажи из виктори и виктори-2: Пише, Плутия и Удзуме. Только появляются они довольно поздно.
Минусы:
-убрали раздевание из Action U.
-бои стали менее мясными.
-новые арены радуют, но повторяются больше старых, а новая возможность (прыгать по пузырькам) плохо проработана и встречается лишь раз.
-в эндинге представлена куда более интересная версия игры про Бланк (а эта игра посвящена ей), и куда более, ну, "про Бланк". Сама игра, не смотря на название, игрой про Бланк является с натяжкой, особенно по сравнению с игрой Нуар.
Отдельно следует отметить мультиплеер (впервые в непках!). Он куда более адекватен геймплейно, чем синглплеер, но контента в нем ровно на одинь день серьезной игры. Тем не менее, именно за этот мультиплеер, которого так не хватало в Action U, я и ухвачусь, ставя положительную оценку этой игре.

A typical hack and slach game, just mash buttons and you'll likely win. However I absolutely loved the story, it does not make much sense but that just adds Nepness to the game! And Blanc is the main of the game, what more can you ask?!

Game mechanics are pretty simple but great. You just need to mash the buttons to win but must still defend and run away from enemies if needed so there's stil some tactical gameplay going on despite being minute,

Characters and humar are the best selling point of the game. If you've played Nep games before you'll no longer need to understand anything because... welll... Neptune. For those who are new to the series there game is absolutely great is you want a hack and slash game. Missions are too short however to my liking, I finish some missions in under ten seconds so for people who are looking for a challenge this is not the game for you. The point of the game is to just bash some zombies dead and continue to the next take. The story and humor of the characters are the things that bring the fun in this game.

Overall, I absolutely loved this. Much better than Neptunia U!

I'd recommend this to any Neptunia fan, although if you're new to the series start with Re;birth 1 first.

30480514.review:
Personally, I was pretty disappointed in this game, as I was expecting a big improvement to Hyperdimension Neptunia U, but that's not what it is... It's not really a bad game, just completely different than what I was imagining/hoping for. :(

They did improve a few points, though, so I'll say a few things I think they did better and worse and stuff.
First, the better: [list]
[*] I liked the added customization options for the characters (the accesories, mostly) and weapons, it was a pretty cool addition to be able to make them feel more personal.
[*] The support characters are pretty cool and add some more options.
[*] Multiplayer is a cool idea (I haven't personally tried it myself yet)
[/list]
Neutral? (I guess):[list]
[*] The leveling system/skill upgrades are kind of cool, but with the normal combos requiring certain levels of upgrading to fully perform, it's part of combat's clunkiness (mentioned more later)
[*] The story and missions aren't very coherent, but it's pretty funny and all, so that's fine.
[*] The Clothes Break from U is no longer in, I usually just used sturdy clothes in U once they were unlocked (more family-friendly and all) but it was a cool idea that defense would lower and ability recover rate rose when your clothes broke. [spoiler]And the animations were dang cute, I'll admit.[/spoiler] Now the broken clothes are just one of the outfits.
[/list]
The worse:[list]
[*] The combat is much clunkier, skills are harder to use (need to defend in order to use a skill, so the fluidity is messed up) and no longer customizable (and you can't see which skills you can use like in U, so you have to either memorize them or hope the one you chose works well)
[*] The controls in general don't seem to work as well, in my opinion (I always have to check how to transform and stuff when I come back because it's different than U. And there's items in this that I rarely, if ever, use since it's annoying trying to choose them during battle...
[*] There's a lot of stuff missing that was in U, like equipping different skills and the three stat-changing item slots, etc.
[/list]


Overall I'd still recommend it, just don't expect Action Unleashed 2 or anything, which was what I was thinking.

29478409.review:
本作作为海王星系列的一个外传，讲述[strike]无良电影制作商[/strike]我呸！青春少女们[strike]我很怀疑她们的年龄[/strike]为了拯救她们心爱的学园，挺身而出制作电影顺手拯救世界的故事。

本作的战斗系统仍然是和U一样的无双制（毕竟人家搞出来的新玩法不能玩了一次就扔了啊），但是操作难度有所上升。最主要的表现就是角色的惯性增加，硬直时间加长，闪避不再那么灵活，人物攻击范围也减少了。

同时BOSS战斗力大幅度上升，这代的BOSS也再也不会像U的那些BOSS一样被硬直到死，一般来说BOSS在受到多次攻击后会被击倒一次，持续几秒，这段时间BOSS是没有反抗能力的，但是除此之外，BOSS不会硬直（少数特殊BOSS比如单人的最终BOSS会在使用一些特殊攻击后硬直一段时间，这段时间就是你攻击的最好时间）,同时每个BOSS都有复数的攻击方式（最烦的就是大史莱犬还有那个忘了啥名字的石头人的那种跳在天上的攻击QWQ，还有那个猩猩，不过那个好像不是BOSS），导致BOSS战难度非常大。

我认为本作相比于U一个很大的优点就是音效，人物动作等的优化。虽然我打了60小时，但是因为主要是在用几个单独的人物，所以并没有玩全人物，可能导致这段会有失真，请谅解QWQ。首先在音效方面，音效的真实感加强了，同时也间接加强了打击感，至少对于我比较常用的基雅来说，这作砍怪的时候你每刀砍下去的音效会让你有种砍到肉里面的感觉，而不像U那样“嘟嘟嘟”的砍果冻的感觉。

至于动作，首先，当你的角色被击倒后，一般形态的人在起来时会有一个后空翻的动作，而女神形态则是一个被击退后用手支撑地面的动作。对比U的被击倒后慢慢起来，是不是很有一种高战力人物的感觉？[strike]俗称逼格高[/strike]。同时我很喜欢UNI的那个战术翻滚的动作。我记得不错UNI是生存社还是什么社的成员，这个动作虽然是为了削弱UNI，但是还是让UNI有一种身手敏捷，久经沙场的感觉（UNI酷酷哒~）。

[h1]吐槽[/h1]

[spoiler]剧情继承了海王星系列剧情的特点：萌以及没啥逻辑性（别给我说阿虚QWQ）。

首先你们8个人来上课就把国家放着不管了？就算4国大主教能够治理国家，8个女神全部失踪怎么解释？（不要给我说国民知道8女神是去上课了，如果知道8女神去上课我怀疑这学校完全不可能没人气啊。）

发尸潮这么大的事情你们不把4国军队调过来镇压顺便把学校搜个底朝天，反而拿来拍电影。这女神是怎么当的？

顺便这学校还能正常运作以及居然还有转校生我也只能说这封锁消息的效率有点高.....

不过我最想吐槽的还是......

你们学校我怀疑是不是军事学院啊？去上个学拿刀拿剑拿大锤的我就不说什么了，拿枪是几个意思？虽然UNI是那啥什么社的，但是这枪怎么看都是真玩意儿啊，拿着到处跑没人管嘛......害怕QWQ[/spoiler]

Las cosas en contra al menos desde mi punto de vista son que tiene mapas bastante grandes pero no se aprovechan casi nada por que lo único que haces es buscar la pelota de bichos a masacrar y ya, cómo todos los juegos japoneses se premia el hacer los escenarios a todo correr en vez de hacerlos "bien", los tiempos de carga son un infierno, tarda una eternidad para jugar escenarios que te van a durar cómo mucho un minuto y medio, los jefes son cómo mucho sacos de golpes con patrones de ataque muy simples y fáciles de sobrepasar, 

Ahora hablo desde mi experiencia para sacar todos los logros, es un soberano coñazo. Los drop rates de algunos objetos (tesoros y partes oscuras) son una locura, para ver todas las escenas tienes que salir al menú principal con sus pertinentes pantallas de carga, el logro del combo de 5.000 golpes lo tuve que sacar con uno de los truquetes que hay por alguna guia que han colgado en la comunidad, lo mismo tuve que hacer para sacar el logro de matar a todos los enemigos y conseguir los tesoros.

Ahora si me preguntaís ¿recomendaría el juego? os diría que si, pero esperaría a alguna oferta de 7-8 euros, pagar más cómo hice yo me parece tontería.

Needless to say much, it's probably one of the worst port for a Neptunia game. I've bought & played every Hyperdimension Neptunia franchise they have on Steam pronto, and this is probably the worst one yet among all due to multiple issues in the game. (Based from personal experience.)

28827769.review:
First of i want to tell you (the reader) that I never had played any games from the Neptunia "universe". I know some of the characters from 4.chan /vg/ but as i said i have no real clue who is who. I really looked forward to test this game since i thought to myself that it looked kinda fun - and well a coop mode is something i really enjoy in games nowadays.

The games i normally play are team based FPS games like CS or if we talk about a diffrent genre - the Souls Series (since most RPG´s like TES games are to casual for my taste). Since i am a huge anime fan this game got my attention - but well i never gave it a "go"

Now lets see how the game plays and feels to someone who never played anything in this genre/universe before.

After i started the game i looked at an intro that had a catchy song „be my zombie“ and introduced me to the characters of this universe - the intro feels a bit like watching a good anime opening - from the quality how its made.

Intro 9/10

The "main" menu had a average amount of ingame settings that i could adjust (pretty basic but still all i needed).
rly like the orginal jap voice acting but dunno why i like the english voice actors so much

Settings 7/10

Sine i normally watch animes in english sub - i started the game with the orginal voice acting - that was very fitting to the characters of the game. Still - i switched to the english voice acting mid game and this was very good to.

Voice/Sound 9/10

When i started playing the story mode i got briefed about the story of the game and got small and quick tutorial missions where the player learned the "basic" controlls of the game. I had some problems in the beginning tho - i know the Souls Series have pretty bad controlling but this was "hard" for me at start (i had problems with the lock on enemy funtion)
Maybe i was just not used to this controll "scheme". That was the only thing i did not like about the game but still its about learning (as in the Souls Series) - "Git Gud?!"
I liked the Story behind the game, but since i don´t know that much about the characters and universe i have to skip this part - i would recommend you reading other reviews below mine - for this part at least.

Controlls 4/10 (if you get used to them i would rate them 6/10
Story 8/10 

About the Art/Visuals of the game i have to say - i really enjoyed the parts where the characters talked to each other - the feeling of reading an manga came in my mind. The 3d "gameplay visuals were pretty basic - nothing special, nothing bad.

Art 8/10
Visuals 6/10

Well then mid game i tried out the coop part and well this one was very fun - best part of the game for me ( i just love "jolly cooperation"). You can play the entire story mode with an friend or with a random person online. So no further comment from my side for this part of rating.

Coop 10/10 (i had no connection problems at all - played from EU with NA friend)

I still have to finish the game and well i am looking forward to do this plus all the unlocks you can get for each of characters. 

So Would i recommend this game? Yes

My final rating for MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies will be an 7,5/10 (the controlls part was the part where it could had reached an 8 easy but well as i said thats the only thing i did not enjoyed that much.
I am looking forward to play more games that take place in this "universe".

/cheers

Law.

28816708.review:
*sigh* You know I am actually a huge fan of the Hyperdimension series, even the spin-offs like Hyperdimension U: Action Unleashed were great! And I kind of hoped, that Blanc+Neptune vs Zombies would be equally as good as Action Unleashed, especially giving the great ratings it got and the similar looking gameplay. Honestly I dont understand why many people say its so great, it is in fact very disappointing. Barely any unlockables or game modes, outfits are only color swaps most of the time and the story is... painfully cheesy, doe that one is intended so it makes it quiet funny.
I will summerize the Pro and Cons for a better overview.

Pro: 
- Full Hyperdimension Neptune cast
- Colorful and funny dialogues like in the other games
- A tiny bit of fan service
- Cheesy as heck, but still very enjoyable
- Co-op mode

Cons:
- Barely any unlockables
- Short story, without much content
- Not able to restart levels
- Characters control like tanks, go down in a few hits doe
- Sooooooooooooo many Looooaaaaaadiiiiiiing screeeeeeeeeeeeens
- Locking onto enemies is weirdly difficult
- Characters are unable to move when hit or untill their move animation is over (like swinging the weapon), 
   making them a very easy target
- Transforming in battle or leveling up makes almost no difference when fighting
- Bulletsponge enemies
- Unlockable outfits only color swaps most of the time

Overall rating from my side: 5/10

If you are a fan of the series and you can find it for like 6 - 10 bucks or so, then get it. It does have funny cringeworthy moments. But if you hope to find the same variety of content or fun like in the other titles, Im afraid you will be disappointed aswell. To everyone new to the franchise: Start with Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth1 or Action Unleashed.

28399963.review:
While the controls feel a bit finnicky still, I feel like this is overall a more polished version of the sort of game Hyperdimension Neptunia U Action Unleashed was trying to be. It pulls the action-hack-and-slash gameplay off more elegantly and the characters in general feel more balanced. For instance, ranged characters are no longer effectively god mode.

The plot is about what I've come to expect from a Neptunia title: The goddesses attend school to try and understand humans better. There's a zombie outbreak. So they decide to film a zombie movie while resolving the zombie outbreak to advertise the school.

This game includes multiplayer, which is pretty fun and a bit chaotic. It has a Monster Hunter Lite feel, especially with the bigger bosses.

The only honest complaints I have about it is the farming required for some of the Treasure items, which gets repetitive when you only need 1 item that drops from 1 boss and wind up doing that boss 50 times. This is especially annoying for the multiplayer mission-specific treasures.

28392012.review:
3rd game I got from the Nep Nep Fandom, and probably my first hack n slash I got into.
This game story is rather interesting. A bunch of goddess going to school and doing a movie. What could possibly go wrong? Nice plot turning, and some peoples might complain about the lack of seriousness, but he? That is what make the Neptunia serie great for me, and if you can't live with it, you are in the wrong fandom.

-The inclusion of Tamsoft and some characters of the main series, which were missing in Action Unleashed, made the fighting more interesting. Sometimes I just find myself button mashing until I find a usefull combo.
-The inclusion of the fan service from the previous Hack n Slash of the serie made it a bit awkward, as I didn't play Action Unleashed before this game, and didn't expect they give the Costume Break as a costume from the start.
-For the Multiplayer, its rather dead but still worth it if you know peoples actually playing the game. Its also a great way to break the main story and raise your character with less grinding (in the case you play online with someone who is farer in the game).

Even if some peoples complain about the gameplay, I find it pretty neat and a good addition to the serie. I recommend this game for peoples of the Fandom, but you can start with this one if you want. I would say one should rather play the main serie, then go on Action Unleashed before playing this game, as you shall then understand who Dengekiko and Famitsu are, and why the latest slap peoples faces with a giant lobster.

作为外传性质的作品，剧情方面最好的接受方法就是不要带着脑子看，看到什么是什么就好，这样看看的话剧情还是很有意思的，对话里玩梗也依然玩的很欢。虽然是僵尸题材的，但整个剧情一直透着一股欢脱的气氛。

游戏难度方面一如既往的随意，前几章随便打打就过了，后面几章随便打打就被打死了...——不，实际上后几章也挺简单的，只是有那么几个关卡要难打一些，会出现“前一关千辛万苦，后一关毫不费力”的情况，至于剧情的最终BOSS...恕我直言，能在屁股后面做人的都不叫怪。

[strike] 不过以上都不是这款游戏的重点，反正能看到萌妹子、听到各位声优的声音，萌豚们就没有怨言了（笑） [/strike]

[spoiler] 顺带不知道会不会更新爆衣补丁呢 [/spoiler]

27794735.review:
The Neptunia Games have always been a matter of whether you love the games or just straight up hate them. I'm more in the middle but that's for another topic.

Let's get this review out of the way: How did this game came to be you may ask? Simple answer - take Hyperdimesion Neptuina U, give a zombie makeover with a zombie story, add the schoolgirl genre because it wouldn't be Japanese enough right and take everything that made U fun and throw it all away and you get this. A fast paced hack and slash that's quite slow to be honest especially compared to Senran Kagura and Hyperdimension Neptunia U which are much faster paced and are actually fun to play. 

The story is about as ordinary as any zombie based story is: the school is infested with zombies(it's actually a play but who's paying attention to this badly written story)and it's up to the Neptunia Cast to stop them(Loose sense of the word). And that's where all the problems begin - the zombie thing has been done to death(pun intended)by the Western World to the point all you need is zombies and BAM! Instant money(coughcough The Walking Dead coughcough). So the makers of this game(must be on something high)thought they can input their ideas into the genre and added the most cliche thing ever: schoolgirls(because it wouldn't be Japanese if it didn't have them). The game has crashing problems when changing the screen size or just changing the screen to full size which is retarded as hell. The story is a snooze and the shop menu(for buying weapons, why am I telling you this, no idea)doesn't work and does this freezy thing(music plays in the background but you can't see anything!!!)causes a crash where the game sorta hits a freezy moment until you press B(I use a gamepad. Obvious reasons)

They took the one thing that made U slighty more interesting: the clothing break system. Thats bad when you consider it's made by the same people who did U and Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus. Sucks when you think about huh?

Through and through the game isn't as bad as the haters say but it's too far from good like the supporters of the Series say it is. You can definitely find a better game out there, so keep looking and pass on this title.

P:S - I loved Neptunia U and I really wanted to love this one too because I have a love/hate relationship with the Main Series because they're turn-based and I'm not a fan of turn-based combat. But I really can't recommend this even to the diehard fans. If you have to get this game, get it for the PS Vita. You'll thank me by not getting it's crappy PC Port(which seems to be the trend for PC Games made this year: all of them are crappy)

*Breathes out.* Finally. That's over. Peace!

This game is a nep game. Not much else to say. its fun. and the character interactions are great. I have not played HDN:U so i cannot compare the two but the gameplay in this game is Sub - Par. its not great but not so horribly dull that you will want to stop playing. Leveling up and building your character feels great, though i kinda just leveled up one character... by the time i got what i wanted i was already op with nep... in short singleplayer is gud, is fun, gud game. now most people (including me and my friend) saw the coop part of this game and thought. Yes. The coop is, well, not boring, but not the best, if your wondering no you cannot play through the story in coop. Instead you go through a series of missions varying in difficulty. and i have to say... they are really easy, like, wow... though to be honest the whole game easy. connectivity is a problem sometimes to, occasionaly we wont be able to connect to one another for no reason but i didnt expect better. Overall i give it Nep/Nep if you adore the interactions between characters of gamindustri this game is for you, if your looking for a ARPG with coop, this is not the game for you. im not good with reviews, but i enjoyed the game.


Side Note: DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU DONT HAVE A CONTROLLER

26503493.review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies - Це спін-офф популярної серії ігор про богинь-ЦП. В якій дівчата попадають до світу людей і щоб ви думали, вступають в звичайну школу щоб краще пізнати культуру і звичаї людського виду, але стається лихо і школу хочуть закрити за непопулярність, тут нашим героїням приходить в голову зняти кіно-жахастик з зомбі щоб прорекламувати свою школу. Ідея наче хороша, але під час зйомок на школу нападають справжні зомбаки, що стає в пригоді нашим героїням, вони вирішують їх використовувати при зйомках свого фільму =)
Сюжет доволі простий і не надто довгий, але має декілька цікавих поворотів. А головне діалоги справді веселі, Це звісно порівняння, сатира і висміювання, але дуже часто справді влучно =)

Відносно основної серії ігор тут є декілька змін, по-перше геймплейно це не покрокова стратегія, а скоріше слешер. По-друге в грі є мережевий кооператив, ну і звісно головним протагоністом цього разу буде Бланк, хоча Неп йде відразу поруч =)

Графічно гра не отримала ніяких покращень що до інших ігор серії, хоча до переваг можна занести багато нових моделей монстрів, а в цілому все стандартно - доволі скромні локації, і чудові моделі персонажів під час діалогів.

В плані звуку хочеться виділити, що тепер в грі озвучені всі (наче) діалоги, частково це пояснюється меншою кількістю цих самих діалогів, але тим не менше така тенденція не може не тішити. Звісно з нами всі чудові голоси з попередніх ігор, так само як і японські звукові доріжки оригіналу, для фанатів читати субтитри =)

Як я вже казав геймплейно гра є скоріше екшн слешером, в якій ми наносимо швидкі атаки котрі можна, а на пізніших етапах гри навіть потрібно, обєднувати в комбінації для ще сильнішого пошкодження, також є супер атаки котрі можна як виконувати самому, так і в кооперативі з друзями, в цілому геймплей доволі простий для освоєння, і доволі цікавий для експерементування, так як персонажів в грі справді багацько (більше 20-ти) і кожен грає по своєму, що дуже урізноманітнює гру.

В цілому, ця гра не претендує на звання найкращої в серії, але завдяки різноманітності персонажів, і веселим діалогам, як і секретним діалогам зможе заставити пройти себе навіть двічі чи більше, а з друзями в кооперативі стане ще цікавішою.

Рекомендую =)

26363327.review:
[h1]Entering the Nepiverse[/h1]

Going into MegaTagmension (MT) as a newcomer to the Neptunia series, I was thinking that I would be playing some sort of visual novel with hyper-sexualized content under a metaphorical cloak of story progression. Or maybe something with such prolific fan service that I'd have to worry about someone walking in through the door. Little did I know that I was getting myself thrust into a world bathed in 14 different flavors of cuteness. Maybe I've been playing way too many outlandish anime games, but this VN fused with action elements managed to show such a refreshing sense of originality and style that I couldn't help but swoon at its characters. At its core, MT is a fully voiced VN with a little bit of beat em up/hack & slash thrown in, not too dissimilar to the Dynasty Warriors/Musou series. These battle sequences are relatively short and aim to enhance the story's sense of credibility, but ultimately plays a backseat role in expanding Idea Factory’s Neptunia universe.

In this newest release, a small band of girls who seemingly represent their entire academic population are uniting to save their school, Gamicademi, from closing down. In the opening scene, Blanc overhears her sisters being attacked by ghoulish zombies. To her surprise, the zombies are actually actors cast by Neptune in an effort to create a high profile movie with the hopes that it'll be the school's saving grace. Naturally, Blanc decides to join in on the fun and direct the movie herself; however, in a rather ludicrous turn of events real zombies end up getting involved, even if they are neglected between shoots. It is now up to these heavily equipped Powerpuffs to make sure Gamicademi lives to see its grand return to the spotlight.

[h1]MegaTag-Teaming[/h1]

Now saving Gamicademi may be of the utmost importance to Blanc, but some part of me did not allow myself to proceed without first changing all of the girls' outfits to their torn counterparts… Moving on, I began to notice important personalization options other than cute costumes and accessories. Japanese and English voice options are available, to my surprise, helping me solidify my stance to support the original dubbing. For the non-purists out there, the English VAs are actually much better than the average folk employed in domestic dubs, and I even found it to be less cringy and sensual than usual. Either way, I definitely liked the ability to pick audio languages, and feel a need to commend whoever was responsible for that decision. Delving further, MT also lets players have a choice in who they cast for each scene event or fight. This ends up creating "alternate cuts" depending on who you cast, as the resulting scene's dialogue and special events system follow your decisions to an extent. This responsibility puts you in Blanc's shoes, creating the story direction of your choosing in a much more immersive manner.

Regarding MT's Warriors/Musou-like combat system, various aspects regarding its design makes it to be the weakest mechanic of the game. Really poor camera tracking impedes fluid movement and makes positioning more difficult than it should be. Worse is when there is a boss around that can fly and perform diving maneuvers, compounding to create a slightly debilitating combat experience. Furthermore, most of these battle sequences will be completed within a handful of minutes, requiring very little variability to overcome. As the game progresses, combat ever so slowly feels like tedious exercises in mindless button mashing. It’s a big shame since advanced maneuvers are incorporated, such as taking advantage of animation cancelling, invincibility frames, or aerial combo strings for evasion, but they aren’t necessary at all to beat the game. MT's tag-team mechanics, plentiful amount of unlockable combos, and visually appealing SP/EXE Drive skills help make up for the combat's grievances and keep these portions slightly enjoyable, just much less than ideal. 

MT’s combat oriented multiplayer aspect seems to be the game’s biggest wow-factor when comparing it to other Nep titles, as MT is the only game so far to contain such a system. The ability to group up with 3 other players online in a mode featuring new enemies, bosses, arenas, and VN events not seen in the campaign, add major play value. There are tons of quests separated by Star difficulty, providing rewards and experience to level up character stats that carry over to the story mode. Also, unlike story mode, the multiplayer aspect unlocks every character and transformation from the beginning for use, along with changing some of the combat controls to incorporate online player joint attacks. Strangely, I found the multiplayer mode really enjoyable, even while playing solo along with the fact that the multiplayer combat system is the same as the story mode’s system. It’s most likely attributed to the lengthier and tougher quest challenges, unimpeded by tiny segments of dialogue. Unfortunately, MT’s multiplayer mode seems to have been plagued with connection issues for many players ever since launch, but since I haven’t seen any such problems myself, the only experience I have in multiplayer is a fairly positive one.

[h1]Complete Walkthrough Playlist[/h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tfeYOnddkgk&index=2&list=PLeavCsRFiP55DgIS7mFpBKiRL5C7RXB9u 

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Although the story was a bit absurd, it seems to be what defines the style of the Neptunia games. Plenty of funny jabs at the girls’ own ridiculous situations closely flirt around breaking the fourth wall creating a neat sense of relatability, and Blanc’s “extortion” scheme in obtaining MagiGirl Idol’s support is comically hilarious. What started off strong ended up petering out throughout the second half of the game, as the story essentially kept walking around in circles without introducing any real major changes. A new character here or there with a backstory blended in with something zombie related is the extent of MT’s narrative. It’s a bit of a shame since the game is much shorter than its RPG sister titles; so stretching MT’s story thin is pretty problematic. Worse is the alternating nature of the VN and battle sequences. When you get involved with the VN’s story, you’re forced to fight 2 minute battles, just to watch a 2 minute dialogue and repeat the process (up to four or five times in one scene with multiple loading screens for each transition). It’s hard to get attached to either aspect when the game switches gears so often. 

Regardless, as a casual fan of anime and visual novels, I didn't find the newest installment in the Neptunia series too eccentric to take in, or alienating as an entry point. There weren't too many inside jokes or references, and the iconic song and dance summarizing previous important world aspects is present. After wrapping things up with Blanc and friends, I still found myself wanting to delve more into their world, especially as I only seemed to have observed them in such a confined environment. If you are a long-time Neptunia fan, I’m afraid that my verdict may not be very enlightening or relatable from my perspective. Just know that MT is much, much, shorter than the main series games. But for those that are weary of this as an entry point into the series, I can say that MT seemed to be rather welcoming, and is definitely enjoyable as a VN experience all on its own. There is a desire for improvements in the combat realm, but the multiplayer and VN aspects proved to be commendable enough to make checking out MT, or at least other Neptunia games, rewarding, especially during one of Idea Factory’s deep publisher sales.
